snippet: The company will pare its presence in its electric vehicle charging business, and its home solar division will sell future customer agreements it originates to two partners.
abstract: Residential solar firm NRG Energy says it is scaling back its involvement in two alternative energy ventures in order to cut costs and streamline operations; company, which announced 2016 first-quarter net profit of $47 million, says changes will allow them to break even by 2017.
lead_paragraph: The company will pare its presence in its electric vehicle charging business, and its home solar division will sell future customer agreements it originates to two partners.

headline.main: NRG Steps Back From Alternative Energy Ventures in Cost-Cutting Effort
headline.print_headline: NRG, in Bid to Pare Costs, Trims Green Power Goals
